Returns: A string representation of the DragEvent object.
toString().Description: Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable representation of this DragEvent object.

Returns: true if a drag event listener returned true in response to @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@. If the system did not send @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@ before @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_ENDED_E@, or if the listener returned false in response to @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@, then false is returned.
getResult().Description: Returns an indication of the result of the drag and drop operation. This method only returns valid data if the action type is @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_ENDED_E@. The return value depends on what happens after the user releases the drag shadow. If the user releases the drag shadow on a View that can accept a drop, the system sends an @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@ event to the View object's drag event listener. If the listener returns true, then getResult() will return true. If the listener returns false, then getResult() returns false. Notice that getResult() also returns false if no @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@ is sent. This happens, for example, when the user releases the drag shadow over an area outside of the application. In this case, the system sends out @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_ENDED_E@ for the current operation, but never sends out @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@.

Returns: The ClipDescription that was part of the ClipData sent to the system by startDragAndDrop().
getClipDescription().Description: Returns the @B_android#content#ClipDescription_E@ object contained in the @B_android#content#ClipData_E@ object sent to the system as part of the call to @B_android#view#View#startDragAndDrop_E@. The drag handler or listener for a View can use the metadata in this object to decide if the View can accept the dragged View object's data. This method returns valid data for all event actions except for @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_ENDED_E@.

Returns: The current drag point's X coordinate
getX().Description: Gets the X coordinate of the drag point. The value is only valid if the event action is @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_STARTED_E@, @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION_E@ or @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@.

Parameters: Parcel: A @B_android#os#Parcel_E@ object in which to put the DragEvent object.
int: Flags to store in the Parcel.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).Description: Creates a @B_android#os#Parcel_E@ object from this DragEvent object.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).FullName: public void writeToParcel (Parcel dest, int flags)

Returns: The current drag point's Y coordinate
getY().Description: Gets the Y coordinate of the drag point. The value is only valid if the event action is @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_STARTED_E@, @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION_E@ or @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@.

Returns: The local state object sent to the system by startDragAndDrop().
getLocalState().Description: Returns the local state object sent to the system as part of the call to @B_android#view#View#startDragAndDrop_E@. The object is intended to provide local information about the drag and drop operation. For example, it can indicate whether the drag and drop operation is a copy or a move. The local state is available only to views in the activity which has started the drag operation. In all other activities this method will return null This method returns valid data for all event actions.

Parameters: Parcel: A @B_android#os#Parcel_E@ object in which to put the DragEvent object.
int: Flags to store in the Parcel.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel,int).Description: Creates a @B_android#os#Parcel_E@ object from this DragEvent object.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel,int).FullName: public void writeToParcel (Parcel dest, int flags)

Returns: The ClipData sent to the system by startDragAndDrop().
getClipData().Description: Returns the @B_android#content#ClipData_E@ object sent to the system as part of the call to @B_android#view#View#startDragAndDrop_E@. This method only returns valid data if the event action is @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DROP_E@.

describeContents().Description: Returns information about the @B_android#os#Parcel_E@ representation of this DragEvent object.

Returns: One of the following action constants, in the order in which they usually occur during a drag and drop operation: ACTION_DRAG_STARTED ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION ACTION_DROP ACTION_DRAG_EXITED ACTION_DRAG_ENDED
getAction().Description: Inspect the action value of this event.

ClassDesc: Represents an event that is sent out by the system at various times during a drag and drop operation. It is a data structure that contains several important pieces of data about the operation and the underlying data. View objects that receive a DragEvent call @B_android#view#DragEvent#getAction_E@, which returns an action type that indicates the state of the drag and drop operation. This allows a View object to react to a change in state by changing its appearance or performing other actions. For example, a View can react to the @B_android#view#DragEvent#ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED_E@ action type by by changing one or more colors in its displayed image. During a drag and drop operation, the system displays an image that the user drags. This image is called a drag shadow. Several action types reflect the position of the drag shadow relative to the View receiving the event. Most methods return valid data only for certain event actions. This is summarized in the following table. Each possible @B_android#view#DragEvent#getAction_E@ value is listed in the first column. The other columns indicate which method or methods return valid data for that getAction() value: The @B_android#view#DragEvent#getAction_E@, @B_android#view#DragEvent#getLocalState_E@ @B_android#view#DragEvent#describeContents_E@, @B_android#view#DragEvent#writeToParcel_E@, and @B_android#view#DragEvent#toString_E@ methods always return valid data.
